body_html:
Your title is misleading. As shown in your profiler output, dataloader is not the issue. You should transform the loaded image to tensors in dataset .getitem to speed things up. http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torchvision/transforms.html#torchvision.transforms.ToTensor

GitHub is more suited for bug report. For this type of post, it should be better placed at https://discuss.pytorch.org/ as more people can help you there.

Your title is misleading. As shown in your profiler output, dataloader is not the issue. You should transform the loaded image to tensors in dataset .getitem to speed things up. http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torchvision/transforms.html#torchvision.transforms.ToTensor
GitHub is more suited for bug report. For this type of post, it should be better placed at https://discuss.pytorch.org/ as more people can help you there.
body:
Your title is misleading. As shown in your profiler output, dataloader is not the issue. You should transform the loaded image to tensors in dataset .__getitem__ to speed things up. http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torchvision/transforms.html#torchvision.transforms.ToTensor

GitHub is more suited for bug report. For this type of post, it should be better placed at https://discuss.pytorch.org/ as more people can help you there.
